discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
Typo Correct Answer: As stated in Security-Guidance-v4.0, Pg 33, “When contemplating hybrid cloud environments, the governance strategy must consider the minimum common set of controls comprised of the Cloud Service Provider’s contract and the organization’s internal governance agreements.”. Thus, the correct answer is E.

As stated in Security-Guidance-v4.0, Pg 33, “When contemplating hybrid cloud environments, the governance strategy must consider the minimum common set of controls comprised of the Cloud Service Provider’s contract and the organization’s internal governance agreements.”. Thus, the correct answer is C.

questions.question_text: In which deployment model should the governance strategy consider the minimum common set of controls comprised of the Cloud Service Provider contract and the organization's internal governance agreements?
What is known as the interface used to connect with the metastructure and configure the cloud environment?

discussion.content: As stated in Security-Guidance-v4.0, Pg 69 “cloud computing is the act of taking physical assets (like networks and processors) and using them to build resource pools. Metastructure is the glue and guts to create, provision, and deprovision the pool. The management plane includes the interfaces for building and managing the cloud itself, but also the interfaces for cloud users to manage their own allocated resources of the cloud”. Thus, the correct answer is B.

questions.question_text: Big data includes high volume, high variety, and high velocity.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Security Guidance --> page 147 --> 14.1.1 Big Data

Gartner defines it as such: “Big data is high volume, high velocity, and/or high variety
information assets that require new forms of processing to enable enhanced decision
making, insight discovery and process optimization.”

questions.question_text: What does it mean if the system or environment is built automatically from a template?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A template change only performs an update if an automated pipeline run and deployment are configured. Answer B

Selected Answer: C
10.1.3.4 If the system or environment is built automatically from a template, likely from a CI/ CD pipeline, then any changes made in production will be overwritten by the next code or template change.
Actually C and D are correct, but in single-choice question, I would go for C, as it has the more significant security implications.

Selected Answer: C
I think it is C. these environments are automatically built for us from a set of source file definitions (templates), they can also be immutable. This means that any changes that are manually implemented will be overwritten the next time a template is run

Selected Answer: C
In this one I would go with C (personally I would go with C & D) but I think C is the best
According to Domain 10
• Elasticity. Elasticity enables greater use of immutable infrastructure. When using elasticity tools like auto-scale groups, each production system is launched dynamically based on a baseline image ..............
operational requirements mean you never want to allow an administrator to log into a system 
and make changes, since they will be lost during a normal auto-scale activity

choices.E: Changes made in production are untouched by the next code or template change.
choices.D: Changes made in test are overwritten by the next code or template change.
choices.B: It depends on how the automation is configured.
choices.C: Changes made in production are overwritten by the next code or template change.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
10.1.3, Code Review: This is a manual activity that's not necessarily integrated into automated testing...
CCSK Study Guide pg 114: Code Review: This is a manual activity that’s not necessarily integrated into automated testing

questions.question_text: Which type of application security testing involves manual activity that is not necessarily integrated into automated testing?
